arts.ttl: Michael Carrick pulls no punches as he makes Middlesbrough merit point after Swansea City defeat
arts.sum: Michael Carrick was in no mood to defend his Middlesbrough players after their defeat to Swansea City, admitting they deserved nothing from the game in an uncharacteristic performance. I just don’t think we did enough in the game.”

arts.ttl: What Michael Carrick said when asked about Erik Pieters after Dael Fry's Middlesbrough injury
arts.sum: Losing 1-0 to a Jisung Eom goal in South Wales, Boro ’s miserable day was compounded by the loss of Dael Fry to what Carrick confirmed was a groin injury. Michael Carrick confirmed that Middlesbrough are taking a look at veteran defender Erik Pieters as they suffered yet another defensive injury blow in their defeat to Swansea City.

arts.ttl: Woeful Boro performance in Swansea loss compounded by nightmare Dael Fry injury
arts.sum: Compounding matters for Boro and severely denting their play-off hopes, last remaining fit centre-back Dael Fry went off injured too, as Boro finished the game with midfielder Jonny Howson and left-back Neto Borges at centre-back. Far from a side coming in off the back of two wins and fighting for a play-off side, Boro looked miles off the pace.

arts.ttl: Eom Ji-sung nets Swansea winner to harm Middlesbrough’s play-off hopes
arts.sum: The South Korean winger opened his scoring account for the Welsh club on his 30th appearance.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough take free-agent defender on trial to prove fitness as injury-crisis bites
arts.sum: It remains unknown at this stage whether Pieters will prove his fitness to play for Boro, with his last competitive appearance coming last March. Pieters, 36, has trained with Boro over the last week or so in an attempt to prove his fitness.

arts.ttl: 'What we're fighting for' - Middlesbrough's excitement for the Championship play-off race - Teesside Live
arts.sum: We’ve got these three games before the international break and then it’s a sprint finish to the end of the season. If Boro can prove they have overcome their recent frustrations and add another win in South Wales this weekend, it will be only the second time this season they’ve managed three straight wins.

arts.ttl: I recently made my 100th Middlesbrough appearance but I'm still surprised when stopped in Tesco
arts.sum: So shy and humble is Hackney, he’s still taken aback when fans recognise him in Tesco - not that he minds in the slightest! “I was actually ball boy for the Brighton game,” he said, recalling the day Boro sealed their last promotion to the Premier League .

arts.ttl: Potential Boro line-up vs Swansea as Michael Carrick faces key call in defence
arts.sum: DC - Dael Fry - Now Boro's only fit centre-back, Fry has been in excellent form since returning from injury and earned the praise of Michael Carrick after the Derby win. CM - Aidan Morris - Having played a crucial role in Boro's victory over Derby County with his influence at both ends of the pitch, Carrick will be hoping for more of the same from the USA international.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough have enjoyed recent trips to Swansea City but my first visit was far from pleasant
arts.sum: Swansea came out in a higher gear in the second half but again Southgate’s men struck at a crucial time with arguably the most spectacular goal scored by Marvin Emnes during his Boro career. Gareth Southgate’s men had just been relegated from the Premier League following a disastrous campaign, while the Swans were entering their second season at this level following promotion from League One. It had been a particularly difficult summer for the Boro, who were under pressure to sell off their quality players to help cope with the potential financial problems at this lower level.

arts.ttl: Seven defensive options for Middlesbrough at Swansea City and beyond amid injury crisis
arts.sum: If Carrick didn’t want to move Borges into the middle though, particularly as the Brazilian is playing so well at left-back of late, then he could call upon club captain Jonny Howson alongside Dael Fry. Again, it’s something the veteran has done plenty of times before in his career. If Boro needed to move Dijksteel into the middle but didn’t have Dede fit to cover for him, or Carrick was reluctant to throw him in so early, then perhaps Iling-Junior would be a left-field option at full-back.
